tendsto_extend_from:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-

Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Patrick Massot, Anatole Dedecker
-/
/-- If `f` converges to some `y` as `x` tends to `x₀` within `A`,
then `f` tends to `extend_from A f x` as `x` tends to `x₀`. -/
theorem tendsto_extend_from {A : set X} {f : X → Y} {x : X} (h : ∃ y, tendsto f (nhds_within A x) ((nhds) y)) :
    tendsto f (nhds_within A x) (nhds <| extend_from A f x) :=
  tendsto_nhds_lim h
#align tendsto_extend_from tendsto_extend_from
extend_from_extends:
theorem extend_from_extends [t2_space Y] {f : X → Y} {A : set X} (hf : continuous_on f A) :
    ∀ x ∈ A, extend_from A f x = f x := fun x x_in => extend_from_eq (subset_closure x_in) (hf x x_in)
#align extend_from_extends extend_from_extends
extend_from_eq:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
theorem extend_from_eq [t2_space Y] {A : set X} {f : X → Y} {x : X} {y : Y} (hx : x ∈ closure A)
    (hf : tendsto f (nhds_within A x) ((nhds) y)) : extend_from A f x = y :=
  haveI := mem_closure_iff_nhds_within_ne_bot.mp hx
  tendsto_nhds_unique (tendsto_nhds_lim ⟨y, hf⟩) hf
#align extend_from_eq extend_from_eq
continuous_on_extend_from:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⁻¹' » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⁻¹' » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- If `f` is a function to a T₃ space `Y` which has a limit within `A` at any
point of a set `B ⊆ closure A`, then `extend_from A f` is continuous on `B`. -/
theorem continuous_on_extend_from [regular_space Y] {f : X → Y} {A B : set X} (hB : B ⊆ closure A)
    (hf : ∀ x ∈ B, ∃ y, tendsto f (nhds_within A x) ((nhds) y)) : continuous_on (extend_from A f) B :=
  by
  set φ := extend_from A f
  intro x x_in
  suffices ∀ V' ∈ (nhds) (φ x), is_closed V' → «expr ⁻¹' » φ V' ∈ nhds_within B x by
    simpa [continuous_within_at, (closed_nhds_basis _).tendsto_right_iff]
  intro V' V'_in V'_closed
  obtain ⟨V, V_in, V_op, hV⟩ : ∃ V ∈ (nhds) x, is_open V ∧ V ∩ A ⊆ «expr ⁻¹' » f V' :=
    by
    have := tendsto_extend_from (hf x x_in)
    rcases(nhds_within_basis_open x A).tendsto_left_iff.mp this V' V'_in with ⟨V, ⟨hxV, V_op⟩, hV⟩
    use V, is_open.mem_nhds V_op hxV, V_op, hV
  suffices : ∀ y ∈ V ∩ B, φ y ∈ V'
  exact mem_of_superset (inter_mem_inf V_in <| mem_principal_self B) this
  rintro y ⟨hyV, hyB⟩
  haveI := mem_closure_iff_nhds_within_ne_bot.mp (hB hyB)
  have limy : tendsto f (nhds_within A y) (nhds <| φ y) := tendsto_extend_from (hf y hyB)
  have hVy : V ∈ (nhds) y := is_open.mem_nhds V_op hyV
  have : V ∩ A ∈ nhds_within A y := by simpa [inter_comm] using inter_mem_nhds_within _ hVy
  exact V'_closed.mem_of_tendsto limy (mem_of_superset this hV)
#align continuous_on_extend_from continuous_on_extend_from
continuous_extend_from:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- If a function `f` to a T₃ space `Y` has a limit within a
dense set `A` for any `x`, then `extend_from A f` is continuous. -/
theorem continuous_extend_from [regular_space Y] {f : X → Y} {A : set X} (hA : dense A)
    (hf : ∀ x, ∃ y, tendsto f (nhds_within A x) ((nhds) y)) : continuous (extend_from A f) :=
  by
  rw [continuous_iff_continuous_on_univ]
  exact continuous_on_extend_from (fun x _ => hA x) (by simpa using hf)
#align continuous_extend_from continuous_extend_from
